comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Here in my country people are not expected to donate to politicians during their political campaign, here those campaigns are supposed to be self-funded or funded by the party. Obviously, that means the ruling party has an unfair advantage over the other parties trying to get elected. I personally have got the impression political donations only  encourage corruption among politicians and their biggest donors, because after the candidate gets elected, those big donors will certainly start to ask for "favors" from politicians. It is quite common in the United States from what I read online. Though, when anyone asks for donations here for whatever reason, they will certainly accept Binance Pay contributions, and other off chain donations to help their cause.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Geremia on October 12, 2023, 04:26:09 AMWhat politicians (in any country) are accepting ₿ donations?This U.S. congress candidate does: https://aversa.vote/Bitcoin is more popular in the US than most countries which is why many politicians in the country accept Bitcoin and Altcoin donations. Politicians in the US have been collecting Bitcoin donations for as early as is 2018 when Missouri Republican Austin Petersen received about 24 Bitcoin to fund his Senatorial ambition. Ted Cruz is accepting Bitcoin to finance his campaign. The politicians in my country don't accept crypto donations because the Central Bank of my country has placed restrictions on banks transacting on cryptos. Bitcoin is not banned in my country but politicians will always avoid crypto donations because it could be used to witch-hunt opposition parties. The government in power will not accept it because of hostile policies and the opposition will not accept it for fear of indictments. Another reason why many politicians don't want to accept donations is because the government claims that it was used to finance a massive protest that nearly led to a revolution. Just like the organizers of the "Freedom Convoy’” protest in Canada that nearly crippled Ottawa was attacked for accepting crypto donations. The government of my country called a peaceful protest a threat to national security and sent the military to kill protesters. And they claim that these protesters were funded by the opposition who wanted to destabilize the nation, so every politician doesn't want to get involved in cryptocurrencies.
